Question
========

Consider the following data graphic from the FiveThirtyEight article ["Biden Is Polling Better Than Clinton At Her Peak"](https://fivethirtyeight.com/features/biden-is-polling-better-than-clinton-at-her-peak/).

![](https://fivethirtyeight.com/wp-content/uploads/2020/08/skelley-CLINTON-BIDEN-STATES.0805-0804-1.png)

Which of the following statements are true?

Answerlist
----------
* The text and arrow draw attention to the moment when Clinton's lead over Trump was largest during the 2016 race, and the magnitude of her lead at that time. 
* The solid horizontal black line at $y=0$ draws attention to when a candidate is leading or trailing in the polls. 
* The solid vertical black line at $x=0$ draws attention to the day of the election. 
* The dotted vertical line at $x=103$ draws attention to the timing of the 2016 Democratic convention and Clinton's polling lead at that time. 
* The contextual elements do not provide meaningful information and the plot would be just as understandable without them. 


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* True.
* True.
* True.
* True.
* False. The context elements are very helpful.
